meanings.definition: Methanes: a colorless, odorless, flammable gas that is the simplest hydrocarbon and the main component of natural gas.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the properties of methanes in the lab.
meanings.sent2: Natural gas is primarily made up of methanes.
meanings.sent3: The clown accidentally filled the balloons with methanes instead of helium!
meanings.sent4: The methanes in the air whispered secrets to the trees.
meanings.sent5: The smell of methanes lingered in the room long after the experiment.

meanings.definition: Methanes: compounds containing one carbon atom and four hydrogen atoms, such as methane gas.
meanings.sent1: The student learned about the structure of methanes in chemistry class.
meanings.sent2: Methane gas is a common example of methanes.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added methanes instead of water to the recipe!
meanings.sent4: The methanes danced together in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The explosion was caused by a leak of methanes in the factory.
